string.text: This faction was unable to cope with the variety of internal and external problems. It now belongs to history.
A clan wishes to join your kingdom!

The {JOINING_CLAN.NAME} clan is looking to join your kingdom{?JOINING_CLAN.IS_MERCENARY} as a mercenary{?}{\?}!{NEW_LINE} {NEW_LINE}They have {TROOPS_DESCRIPTION} and {FIEFS_DESCRIPTION}. Their leader {RELATION} towards you.{NEW_LINE} {NEW_LINE}What say ye?
{FIEFS} {?FIEFS.PLURAL_FORM}fiefs{?}fief{\?} that they {?AT_WAR}will{?}won't be able to{\?} bring with them
Enables a variety of tweaks regarding clans migration between kingdoms. Due to the nature of these changes, they always apply to every clan in the game.
Specify if AI clans should consider player kingdom when they are deciding which kingdom to join or defect to.
Specify if AI clans should consider player kingdom when they are deciding which kingdom to join as mercenaries.
The minimum period in days following a request from an AI clan to join the player's kingdom, after which a new request may appear. Default = 0 (no cooldown).

Specify if AI clans should always pick the most attractive kingdom instead of a random one when considering joining some kingdom or defecting. Enabling this can potentially increase intensity of clan migration between kingdoms.

Fixes a vanilla bug that allowed ruling clans to defect to other kingdoms while remaining the leaders of their former kingdoms. When applied, restricts ruling clans from defecting, unless they are the last active clan in their kingdom, in which case they can defect with all their fiefs and the former kingdom will be destroyed.
